definition: to startle/to be frightened/to be scared/alarm

sentences.english: OBJECTIVE To study the effects of piperine on sleep in mice and rabbits, and analyse anticonvulsant action of piperine in mice.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究胡椒碱对动物睡眠的影响及其抗惊厥作用。

sentences.english: Measles can cause temporary complications, such as convulsions (fits) and diarrhoea.
sentences.chinese: 麻疹能引起暂时并发症，如惊厥和腹泻。

sentences.english: For example, related 1L child high fever convulsion prognosis research.
sentences.chinese: 例如，有关1L童高热惊厥的预后研究。

sentences.english: Antidepressants and anticonvulsants are the two pharmacological classes which represent first-line agents in the management of neuropathic pain.
sentences.chinese: 抗抑郁和抗惊厥药物是治疗神经痛的一线药物。

sentences.english: A small number of children have convulsions (fits).
Febrile seizures is a common childhood disease, the development of febrile seizures is related to many risk factors.
sentences.chinese: 热性惊厥是儿童常见病，其发病与诸多危险因素有关。

sentences.english: The sedative and hypnotic effects of ethyl acetate extracts of eucommia male flowers were studied.
sentences.chinese: 研究杜仲雄花乙酸乙酯提取物的抗惊厥作用。

sentences.english: Anticonvulsive drugs later relieved her of these delusions and most of her other symptoms.
sentences.chinese: 抗惊厥类药物减轻了她的这种错觉以及其他各种症状。

sentences.english: He was hospitalized as a result of febrile convulsion.
sentences.chinese: 他因高热惊厥入院治疗。

sentences.english: His seizures could not be induced by free of micturition or other stimulative factors.
sentences.chinese: 不排尿或其他因素的刺激不能诱发惊厥发作。

sentences.english: Eclampsia is a rare disease that can develop during pregnancy.
sentences.chinese: 惊厥是妊娠期可能发生的罕见并发症。

sentences.english: After the stimulation, convulsion of 100% seizure in rats occurred by the rigidity of double hindlimb as index.
sentences.chinese: 刺激后大鼠100%惊厥发作，以双后肢强直为指标。

sentences.english: The effect of midazolam in seizure control was better than of diazepam.
sentences.chinese: 且控制惊厥疗效好于安定组。

sentences.english: Around 3 children in every 100 have at least one febrile convulsion.
sentences.chinese: 周围的3个孩子，在每100个有至少一个惊厥。

sentences.english: Some anti-convulsant drugs are used in the long-term treatment of epileptics.
sentences.chinese: 有些抗惊厥的药物，长期使用来治疗癫痫。

sentences.english: There is no significant difference in inhibition between transdermal therapy and peroral therapy groups.
sentences.chinese: 药物经皮吸收与口服在抗小鼠惊厥方面无明显差异。

definition: to be in a state of delirium
cyanosis (blue skin due to lack of oxygen in blood)
opitoshtonous (med.), muscular spasm of the body associated with tetanus and meningitis
